alert.note: Alert for Lynn (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 01 at 11:24AM CDT until June 01 at 12:45PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR SOUTHERN LYNN COUNTY... At 1124 AM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing torrential rainfall in O`Donnell. 6 inches of rain have fallen in O`Donnell. Radar indicates amounts of 7 to 10 inches northeast of O`Donnell. The extreme rains are now spreading over US-380 5 to 10 miles east of Tahoka. Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 4 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Tahoka, O`Donnell and New Moore. Sheriff`s office reports mud and water over US-87 four miles north of O`Donnell and some cars loosing control. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1-2 INCHES IN 20 MINUTES
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
